member.name: T:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings
member.summary: Class used to simplify passing all scan settings when scanning. Most settings are optional, leave individual settings null/empty if they should not be changed or if the current device value should be used.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.Device
member.summary:
Device to use to perform the scan operation.
If not set, the default device will be used.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.TransferMechanism
member.summary:
Transfer mechanism used to perform the scan operation.
If not set, will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using or the alias .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.ShowUI
member.summary:
Show scan window provided by the device or scan without showing it.
If not set, will be used.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.CloseUIAfterAcquire
member.summary:
Close scan window provided by the device or leave it shown.
If not set, will be used.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.DuplexEnabled
member.summary:
Should duplex scanning be used.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using or the alias .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.Resolution
member.summary:
Resolution at which to scan.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using and or the alias .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.PageSize
member.summary:
Page size to scan.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using or the alias .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.AutoFeed
member.summary:
Should auto feed be used.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.ColorMode
member.summary:
Which color mode should be used for scanning.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using or the alias .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.ImageQuality
member.summary:
Which quality to use for scanned images, value clamped between 10-100.
Only applied when using the following file formats: PDF, JPEG, PNG. And requires to be set to or .
If not set, the TwainScanning default value will be used.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.TiffImageQuality
member.summary:
Which quality to use for scanned images.
Only applied when using TIFF file format. And requires to be set to or .
If not set, the TwainScanning default value will be used.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.Rotation
member.summary:
How to rotate the image after scanning.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.AutomaticBorderDetection
member.summary:
Should automatic border detection be used.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.Threshold
member.summary:
The threshold between detecting black and white shades (requires to be set to ).
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.Contrast
member.summary:
The contrast to use when scanning.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.Brightness
member.summary:
The brightness to use when scanning.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.ImageCount
member.summary:
Maximum number of images to acquire (-1 acquires all available images, 0 is treated as -1).
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using count parameter in Acquire() and AcquireAsync() methods or .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.MultiPageScan
member.summary:
If scanning to TIFF or PDF, should scanned images be placed into a multi-page file.
If not set, the TwainScanning default value will be used.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.IgnoreBlankPages
member.summary:
Should blank pages be ignored during scanning.
If not set, the device default value will be used.
Note: When not using , same as using .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.PdfProtection
member.summary:
If scanning to PDF, which protection settings to set.
Only applied when using PDF file format. And requires to be set to or .
If not set, the scanned PDF document will not be protected.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Bridgex86.ScanSettings.OutputFileNamesList
member.summary:
Absolute paths for files to acquire to. Use when specific custom names are required for scan result files. Always provide at least as many as there are items to scan, having more is acceptable, but less is not.
Supported file formats: TIFF (default if extension not specified), PDF, JPEG, BMP, PNG. Use same file format for all files, mixing formats is not supported.
If set, the file name parameter specified in will be ignored (mutually exclusive).
Note: When not using , same as using IEnumerable string parameter in any SaveAllTo*() method of an .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticAdjustments.FlipRotation
member.summary: Orients images that flip orientation every other image. ICAP_FLIPROTATION

member.summary: Merges the front and rear image of a document in one of four orientations: front on the top, front on the bottom, front on the left or front on the right. ICAP_IMAGEMERGE

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticAdjustments.ImageMergeHeightThreshold
member.summary: Specifies a Y-Offset in ICAP_UNITS units. Front and rear images less than or equal to this value are merged according to the settings of ICAP_IMAGEMERGE. If either the front or the rear image is greater than this value, they are not merged. ICAP_IMAGEMERGEHEIGHTTHRESHOLD

member.name: T:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticCapture
member.summary: Class that represents automaticCapture capabilities supported by device. The number of images to automatically capture. This does not refer to the number of images to be sent to the Application, use CAP_XFERCOUNT for that.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticCapture.NumberOfImages
member.summary: The number of images to automatically capture. This does not refer to the number of images to be sent to the Application, use CAP_XFERCOUNT for that. CAP_AUTOMATICCAPTURE

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticCapture.TimeBeforeFirstCapture
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the number of milliseconds before the first picture is to be taken, or the first image is to be scanned. CAP_TIMEBEFOREFIRSTCAPTURE

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticCapture.TimeBetweenCaptures
member.summary: For automatic capture, this value selects the milliseconds to wait between pictures taken, or images scanned. CAP_TIMEBETWEENCAPTURES

member.name: T:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticScanning
member.summary: These settings are intended to boost the performance of a Source. The fundamental assumption behind AutomaticScanning is that the device is able to capture the number of images indicated by the value of CAP_XFERCOUNT without waiting for the Application to request the image transfers.This is only possible if the device has internal buffers capable of caching the images it captures.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticScanning.AutoScan
member.summary: Enables the source’s automatic document scanning process. CAP_AUTOSCAN

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticScanning.CameraEnabled
member.summary: When set to true the device will deliver images from the current camera. CAP_CAMERAENABLED

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.AutomaticScanning.CameraOrder

member.summary: Class that represents BarCodeDetection capabilities supported by device. MaxRetries restricts the number of times a search will be retried if none are found on each page. member.name: T:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.Compression
member.summary: Class that represents a collection of capabilities (compression) supported by device. Use JpegQuality capability as a shortcut to select JPEG quantization tables that tradeoff quality versus compressed image size. Used in concert with DAT_JPEGCOMPRESSION it is possible for an Application to obtain the tables that are appropriate for varying percentages of quality within a given Source. TWJQ_UNKNOWN is a read-only value (get or getCurrent), the Application cannot set the Source to this value. This value is reported if the Application uses DAT_JPEGCOMPRESSION to select the quantization tables, and the Source is unable to resolve those tables to a percentage value. The next three TWJQ_ values are intended as markers into the quality range, and are only applicable with set method. get, getCurrent and getDefault only return values in the range 0 - 100. If an Application wishes to map a TWJQ_ value to a corresponding value in the range 0 - 100, then it must issue a get after a set with one of the three TWJQ_ values. No assumption is made about the meaning of the range 0 - 99, it may be derived from the JPEG standard or it may be optimized for the Source's device. 100, though, implies a lossless form of compression. Applications are not encouraged to use this value since it results in poor compression, as well as a format that is not currently widely supported in the industry. TWJQ_UNKNOWN - read-only; must be the setting for this capability if the user sets the JPEG compression tables using DAT_JPEGCOMPRESSION, and the Source is not able to map the selected tables to a specific percentage of quality. TWJQ_LOW - write-only; implies low quality; the images are at the maximum compression recommended by the Source. TWJQ_MEDIUM - write-only; implies medium quality; the images are at the balance point between good compression and good images. This is an arbitrary setting on the part of the Source writer that is expected to best represent their device. This is the value that Applications are most encouraged to use. TWJQ_HIGH - write-only; implies high quality; the images display the maximum quality that produces any kind of meaningful compression. Note that images at this setting are still considered to be lossy.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.Compression.BitOrderCodes

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.Compression.CcittKFactor
member.summary: Used for CCITT Group 3 2-dimensional compression.The ‘K’ factor indicates how often the new compression baseline should be re-established.A value of 2 or 4 is common in facsimile communication.A value of zero in this field will indicate an infinite K factor—the baseline is only calculated at the beginning of the transfer. ICAP_CCITTKFACTOR

member.name: T:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.ImageAcquire
member.summary: Class that allows to manipulate image capability supported by device. Allows an application to request the delivery of thumbnail representations for the set of images that are to be delivered. Setting CAP_THUMBNAILSENABLED to TRUE turns on thumbnail mode. Images transferred thereafter will be sent at thumbnail size (exact thumbnail size is determined by the Data Source). Setting this capability to FALSE turns thumbnail mode off and returns full size images. A successful set of this capability to TRUE will cause the Source to deliver image thumbnails during normal data transfer operations. This mode remains in effect until this capability is set back to FALSE. Application can use this capability to inquire, set, or restrict the values for BRIGHTNESS used in the Source.

member.name: T:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.Resolution
member.summary: Class that allows to manipulate resolutions supported by device. All the X-axis resolutions the Source can provide. Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by ICAP_UNITS (pixels per TWUN_PIXELS yields dimensionless data). That is, when the units are TWUN_PIXELS, both ICAP_XRESOLUTION and ICAP_YRESOLUTION shall report 1 pixel/pixel. Some data sources like to report the actual number of pixels that the device reports, but that response is more appropriate in ICAP_PHYSICALHEIGHT and ICAP_PHYSICALWIDTH. Setting this value will restrict the various resolutions that will be available to the user during acquisition. Applications will want to ensure that the values set for this ICAP match those set for ICAP_YRESOLUTION.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.Resolution.X
member.summary: Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by . ICAP_XRESOLUTION

member.summary: Measured in units of pixels per unit as defined by . ICAP_YRESOLUTION

member.summary: Current/Available optical resolutions for x-axis.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.Resolution.YNativeRes
member.summary: Current/Available optical resolutions for x-axis.

member.summary: Class that allows to manipulate with image transfer of Twain device. To get supported transfers capability MECHANISMS should be called. XferCount set this capability to the number of images you are willing to transfer per session. Common values are: 1 Application wishes to transfer only one image this session -1 Application is willing to transfer multiple images.

member.name: T:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface
member.summary: Class that allows to manipulate with UserInterface of Twain device. To allow an application to query a source to see if it implements the new user interface settings dialog capability EnableDSUIOnly should be call. To check if source supports preview UI CameraPreviewUI should return TRUE. However, the application can choose to use the Source's UI or not even if the Source supports it.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface.CameraPreviewUI
member.summary: This capability queries the Source for UI support for preview mode. If true, the Source supports preview UI. CAP_CAMERAPREVIEWUI

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface.CustomDSData
member.summary: Allows the application to query the data source to see if it supports the new operation triplets. CAP_CUSTOMDSDATA

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface.CustomInterfaceGuid
member.summary: Uniquely identifies an interface for a Data Source, so that an Application can properly interpret its custom content. This is a read only capability. CAP_CUSTOMINTERFACEGUID

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface.EnableDSUIOnly
member.summary: Allows an application to query a source to see if it implements the new user interface settings dialog. CAP_ENABLEDSUIONLY

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface.Indicators
member.summary: If true, the Source displays a progress indicator during acquisition and transfer, regardless of whether the Source's user interface is active. If FALSE, the progress indicator is suppressed if the Source's user interface is inactive. The Source displays device-specific instructions and error messages if either the user interface or progress indicator is turned on.In this case it returns TWCC_OPERATIONERROR to alert the application that it handled the error, and communicated the problem to the user. If both the user interface and progress indicator are turned off, then the Source never displays any message to the user, even if TWCC_OPERATIONERROR is returned.Messages to the user are under the sole control of the Application. CAP_INDICATORS

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface.IndicatorsMode
member.summary: Specify what messages can be displayed if is TRUE. CAP_INDICATORSMODE

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Capability.CapabilitySets.UserInterface.UIControllable
member.summary: If true, indicates that this Source supports acquisition with/without the UI. CAP_UICONTROLLABLE

members.member: Scanning as BMP is very memory consuming, and it is recommended to lower DPI resolution as much as possible. Default is 1200, but recommended is 200 or 300 DPI. This property doesn't have effect on other image formats, it is only for BMP format. s

member.name: P:TwainScanning.GlobalConfig.UseMemoryOptimization
member.summary: If true, it will use less memory but it will be slower. Default is false. Recommened to set to true when working with high DPI.

member.name: T:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection
member.summary: Settings for PDF protection.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.OwnerPassword
member.summary:
Owner password for opening the PDF document after scanning. Owner has all privileges.
Note: Ignored if not set.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.UserPassword
member.summary:
User password for opening the PDF document after scanning. User has limited privileges which are set with permissions.
Note: Ignored if not set.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.SecurityLevel
member.summary:
Encryption level to use when protecting the PDF document after scanning.
Note: Encryption will not be performed if or not set.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitAccessibilityExtractContent
member.summary:
Permit extracting content for accessibility purposes from the PDF document after scanning.
Note: Will not be applied if is not set to .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitAnnotations
member.summary: Permit adding annotations to the PDF document after scanning.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitAssembleDocument
member.summary:
Permit assembling the PDF document after scanning.
Note: Will not be applied if is not set to .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitExtractContent
member.summary: Permit extracting content from the PDF document after scanning.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitFormsFill
member.summary:
Permit filling interactive form fields (including signing) in the PDF document after scanning.
Note: Will not be applied if is not set to .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitFullQualityPrint
member.summary:
Permit printing the PDF document after scanning in full quality.
Note: Will not be applied if is not set to .

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitModifyDocument
member.summary: Permit modifying the PDF document after scanning.

member.name: P:TwainScanning.Collectors.PdfProtection.PermitPrint
member.summary: Permit printing the PDF document after scanning.
